column4: I just did a fresh install of Gusty and I am trying to install my ATI restricted driver and I keep on getting "Could not apply changes! Fix broken packages first."  What do I need to do in order to install the driver?
in synaptic click the Broken filter
find out whats broken and proceed from there (remove it or reinstall)
i just said, in synaptic use the broken filter it will tell you exactly which one is broken
run the command it tells you to run when it says theres a broken package. it should be something like sudo apt-get install -f
when I do sudo apt-get install -f,  it's not telling me anything about broken packages.  it says 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
when I do sudo apt-get install -f,  it's not telling me anything about broken packages.  it says 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
the last few lines of the command don't say anything about broken?
updating, but i've already rebuilt my package list too.

when I tried sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx, I got the message: The following packages have unmet dependencies: xorg-driver-fglrx: Depends: libstdc++5 (>= 1:3.3.4-1) but is not installable... E: Broken packages.
see if libstdc++5 is installed in synaptic, maybe reinstall it
synaptic is telling me libstdc++6 is install, i don't see a 5 though.
synaptic is telling me libstdc++6 is install, i don't see a 5 though.
do a google on installing libstdc++5 you can probably find the link
it's probably out of the repository because its been replace with a newer one
so the fglrx driver needs to be updated to use libstdc++6 and not libstdc++5?
